interfaces

Class BrokerInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • interfaces.BrokerInterface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    class BrokerInterface
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class representing the broker menu that will be displayed in the interface for broker to be able to buy and sell mutual funds for the ATM.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ATM atm
      The ATM that this interface is running on.
      private java.util.Scanner scanner
      The scanner attribute that is used for the brokerto enter inputs into the function.

    • Method Detail

      • displayBrokerMenu

        void displayBrokerMenu()
        The broker menu that the broker sees in the interface.

      • buyFunds

        private void buyFunds()
        Allows the broker to buy funds for the ATM. The broker will have to select the type of fund they want to buy, enter the stock symbol and enter the amount of shares they would like to buy.

      • sellFunds

        private void sellFunds()
        Allows the broker to sell funds from the ATM. The broker will have to selec the type of fund they want to sell, enter the stock symbol and enter the amount of shares they would like to sell.

      • checkIfValid

        private boolean checkIfValid(java.lang.String shares)
        Returns true if the number of shares the broker enters is a valid amount, and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        shares - the number of shares that the broker enters
        Returns:
        a boolean: true if the number of shares the broker enters is a valid amount, and false otherwise.

      • listFunds

        private MutualFund listFunds()
        Allows the broker to select the type of fund they want: either low risk, medium risk or high risk.
        Returns:
        the fund that the broker chooses: either low risk fund, medium risk fund or high risk fund

      • writeObject

        private void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Used in serialization to store the BrokerInterface object.

      • readObject

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Used in serialization to restore the broker interface's information after the ATM is restarted.
        Parameters:
